newsitem.title: USA: Loews loses $467.4 mln on Q2 investments-WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Loews loses $467.4 mln on Q2 investments-WSJ.

text.p: Loews Corp had $467.4 million of gross investment losses in the second quarter, the Wall Street Journal reported in its "Heard on the Street" column.
The paper said in its electronic edition that the losses came on a multibillion-dollar bet against the bull market earlier this year by the Tisch family, which controls 32.0 percent of Lowes stock.
For more than a year, the Tisch team has declared the stock market overvalued, the paper said.
The losses came mostly on equity-index securities, the paper said, meaning that with the market falling in the first quarter, the Tisches believd their bearish take on the market was correct.
They bet the market would continue downward, the paper said.
The losses pushed Loews second-quarter earnings to $0.55 a share, from $3.25 a share a year earlier.
